loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand in Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development.

She practices subsistence farming and also operates a small kiosk selling foodstuffs like tea leaves and sugar. 

Felista is applying for a Kiva loan to buy sugar and tealeaves to add stock to her kiosk. With increased profits, she plans to start baking bread for sale to supplement her income.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy sugar and tea leaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a new business through buying a dairy cow for selling ecological milk, as well as to buy some sheep and construct a livestock barn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cover stitch machine, an overlock machine and raw material to make clothing, so she will be able to increase the amount of work that she has and generate more income.

loans.name: Maira Cristina

texts.es:
Maira, de 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene 9 hijos, pero no todos viven con ella, ya que 4 ya son mayores de edad y tienen su propia familia, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura para cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Maira, ayuda a su esposo en los trabajos de la siembra de granos básicos, para ella es un trabajo duro y cansado, pero que lo hace con mucho gusto porque es gracias a eso que sus hijos han tenido lo necesario.

Maira, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para comenzar a preparar la milpa, porque no tiene dinero para comprar todo lo necesario y ya es tiempo de sembrar. 

Maira, desea que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y que estudien en la universidad y sean personas de éxito.
texts.en:
42 year old Maria is married and has 9 children, but not all of them live with her as 4 of them are already grown up and have their own families. Her husband works in agriculture to cover the household expenses. 
Maria helps her husband with the work of sowing staple grains. For her, it is hard and tiring work, but she does it willingly because it is due to this work that her children have what they need. 
Maria needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies to begin preparing the corn field as she does not have the money to buy all that she needs and it is the sowing season. 
Maria wants her children to have a better quality of life and study at the university so that they can be successful people.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to start preparing the corn field as she doesn't have the money to buy what is needed and it is the sowing season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Siruba sewing machine, an overlock machine, and raw material to make athletic and other clothing, so to increase her work and generate more income.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Doña Ana de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos quienes trabajan y le ayudan con algunos gastos, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, adicional a eso también vende quesadillas, tiene de ser comerciante más de 25 años y empezó sus ventas con capital propio, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana, 63 years old, lives in her own house with her two children who work and help her with some expenses. She works selling fruits and vegetables. In addition to this, she also sells quesadillas. She has been a businesswoman for more than 25 years and began her sales with her own capital. With what she gets from her sales, she manages to get ahead. She is asking for a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables in bulk to be able to continue with her sales and, so, to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Jose Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo, de 54 años de edad, es muy trabajador y responsable, está casado y vive con su esposa y sus hijos, todos estudian y trabajan para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar, su esposa es ama de casa, pero también ayuda con los trabajos agrícolas.

Gerardo, toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, pero también realiza otros trabajitos como peón y también trabaja cuidando ganado, en su comunidad todos lo conocen por ser servicial.

Gerardo, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes y pesticidas, para empezar a sembrar su milpa, ya que este año ha decidido sembrar un poco más de lo que ya había sembrado años anteriores.

Gerardo, sueña con que sus hijos estudien y sean personas de bien y llenos de éxitos.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 54 years old and is very hardworking and responsible. He is married and lives with his wife and children who all study and work to help him with the household expenses. His wife is a housewife and also helps with the agricultural work. 
Gerardo has worked as a farmer all his life but he also does other work such as being a farmhand and raising cattle. In his community, everyone knows him for being helpful.
Gerardo needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides to begin sowing his corn field as, this year, he has decided to sow a little more than he has done in the past.
Gerardo dreams that his children will study and be good people who achieve success.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and pesticides to begin sowing his corn fields.

loans.name: Ana Iris

texts.es:
Ana, de 53 años de edad, se dedicada a la agricultura, es madre de 2 hijos y lucha incansablemente a pesar de ser una madre soltera.

Ana, tiene más de 30 años de sembrar granos básicos, ya que el sustento año tras año y su única fuente de ingresos cuando los comercializa, sus hijos le ayudan en la agricultura y además son excelentes pescadores.

Ella necesita el préstamos para comprar los insumos necesarios para sembrar. 

Ana, sueña con comprar un pequeño terreno para sus hijos y con mucho trabajo en la agricultura y la pesca lo lograrán.
texts.en:
Ana, 53 years old, works in agriculture. She is the mother of 2 children and struggles tirelessly despite being a single mother. 

Ana has been planting basic grains for more than 30 years; it is her sustenance year after year and her only source of income when she sells them. Her children help her in the farming and are also excellent fishermen.

She needs the loan to purchase supplies necessary for planting.

Ana dreams of purchasing a small plot of land for her children and with a lot of work in agriculture and fishing, they will manage it.

loans.use: to purchase supplies necessary for planting.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz es un hombre de grandes sueños y metas que afortunadamente pudo prosperar mucho más rápido él está muy satisfecho porque gracias al crédito él pudo realizar la inversión en la venta de frutas  y gracias a Dios obtuvo muy buenas ganancias, Cruz cuenta que el antes no contaba con las posibilidades suficientes para poder mejorar su negocio pero gracias al apoyo de ADICLA y KIVA ahora su vida a cambiando mucho, pero Cruz con el afán de seguir prosperando ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un  nuevo préstamo para  comprar una cuerda de terreno de 28 x 28 varas para el cultivo de café y banano.
Cruz tiene las esperanzas de conseguir este nuevo crédito para poder adquirir su terreno que tanta falta le hace a su familia y así poder mejorar sus ingresos para luego construir una casa de block para más comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Cruz is a man of big dreams and goals, which fortunately could thrive much more quickly.

He is very contented because, thanks to the loan, he was able to carry out his investment in fruit sales and, thanks to God, he obtained very good returns.

Cruz notes that he did not have sufficient opportunities to be able to improve his business before, but now thanks to the support of ADICLA and KIVA, his life has changed alot. In an effort to continue prospering, Cruz has made the decision to request a new loan in order to buy a 28 by 28 yards-long plot of land for cultivating coffee and bananas.

Cruz hopes to obtain this new loan in order to be able to acquire land, which is necessary for his family, and thus, be able to improve his income for constructing a more comfortable block house for his family later.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land in order to grow coffee and bananas.

loans.name: Danson

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Danson, 47 years old. He is married and a father of three children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012.

He farms maize and beans, as his main business. He has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management which has assisted him in budgeting and record keeping. He is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds, that will help improve on production. This will assist him to cater for his family needs with ease.

Danson is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer that will help improve production

loans.name: Kibakenge Small Scale Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Hellen. She is 30 years old, married, and has eight children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014. 

She farms maize and potatoes. With the training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa she has been able to commercialize her farming and earn more profits from her farming than before. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs, e.g. fertilizers, that will expand her farming business. This will improve her income and allow her to be in a position to provide for her family's basic needs.

Hellen is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for thier help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizers, that will expand her farming business

loans.name: Kyeni Kya Mukuyuni Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Dorocas. She is 43 years old, married, and a mother of six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development.

She operates a general store and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more rice and beans to add stock to her store. This will increase her income to enable her to pay school fees for her children.

Dorocas is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more rice and beans in order to add stock to her general store

loans.name: Kiriri Kuku Kienyeji Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Josphine, a member of Kiriri Kuku Kienyeji Self Help Group. She is married and a mother of seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She does maize, beans and poultry farming as her main business. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management; this has assisted her in budgeting, planning and record keeping. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs. i.e. fertilizer and seeds, to help improve farm output. This will assist her in catering for the family and managing her business well.

Josphine is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, i.e. fertilizer and seeds, to help improve farm output

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
C’est celui qui a sa main posée sur le bélier ! Un emboucheur d’ovin-caprin âgé 32 ans Fako vit avec sa femme et ses 3 enfants au  Mali. il supportent tous ces charges familiales dans l’embouche ovine caprine. Fako est habitué de faire ses ventes en gros dans les marchés environ de Ségou.
 L’emboucheur Fako a souvent le problème de mévente  dans le marché, sinon il peut avoir 150000f CFA par trimestre comme benefice. Pour pouvoir augmenter ces revenus, il est fier d’avoir de prét auprès de RMCR. Fako, son rêve  est d’ inscrire tous ses enfants dans les écoles de haut niveau. Il souhaite d’être financér toujours pour bien vaguer à ces besoins.
texts.en:
Fako is the one holding the goat. He practices sheep- and goat-fattening, is 32 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in Mali. His sheep/goat fattening business allows him to cover all the family expenses. Fako normally sells wholesale at the markets in the Ségou area.

As a livestock fattener, Fako often has problems selling at the markets, but can make up to 150 000 francs profit per trimester. He is proud to have benefited from a loan from the RMCR to help him increase his income. Fako's dream is to enroll of his children in high-quality schools. He would like to benefit from regular loans in order to be able to do this.

loans.use: to buy sheep for later resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in purchasing metal sheeting, wood and nails to replace the roof on his home.

loans.name: Dadojon

texts.ru:
Все великое начинается с малого. Этому пример из жизни Дадочона. Были времена, когда он молодой парень устроился работать пекарем. У него не было ни опыта работы, ни навыков. Благодаря своему усидчивостью и настырностью Дадочон научился вкусно печь традиционные лепешки и через некоторое время сам открыл свою пекарню. Открытия новой пекарни и сбор клиентов оказалось не просто, но с годами с улучшением качество продукции и хорошей репутации, пекарня Додочона собрало немало клиентов. Каждому клиенту Додочон относился исключительно уважительно и обслуживал их максимально быстро и качественно так же как сейчас. 
  На сегодняшний день Додочон счастливый отец четверых детей и верный муж. Ему 38 лет. Его жена помогает ему в работе в пекарне, и этот бизнес стал семейным делом. Когда его дети подрастут, Дадочон передаст им свое мастерство, как тогда его учитель передал свое. 
   Со временем количество клиентов растет, параллельно растут и его дети с расходами. Дадочон вместе с женой приняли решение открыть еще одну пекарню. Чтобы открыть новую пекарю, необходимо купить тестомешалку, установить печь, и отремонтировать помещение, подстроить под пекарню. Для всего этого у них не хватает денежных средств и Дадочон обратился за кредитом.
texts.en:
Everything great starts small. This example is from the life of Dadojon. There was a time when he was a young guy and got a job as a baker. He did neither have experience as a baker, nor education. 

Thanks to his perseverance and decisiveness he learned to bake tasty traditional cakes and after some time he opened his own bakery. To open a new bakery and attract customers was not easy, but through the years, with improvements in product quality and a good reputation, Dadojon managed to get many customers. He treated every customer with respect and served them as quickly and efficiently as possible - and he still does so. 

Now Dadojon is the happy father of four children, and a faithful husband. He is 38 years old. His wife helps him with the work at the bakery, and this has become a family business. When his children grow up, Dadojon will teach them his trade, just like his teacher taught him. 

Currently the number of customers is increasing, and at the same time Dadojon's children and expenses are growing. Dadojon and his wife  took a decision to open another bakery. In order to open a new bakery, the need to purchase a kneader, install a stove and renovate the premises to adjust them to a bakery. They don't have the money for all of this, so Dadojon applied for a loan.

loans.use: to open another bakery through purchasing a kneader, installing a stove and renovating the premises

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Esther. She is 31 years old, married, and a mother of three. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in November 2013.

Esther farms maize and beans as her main business. With the training she received ot from HiH EA, she has been able to commercialize her farming and she is now able to get more profits out of her business. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase more quality fertilizer and add more chicken to a poultry project she intends to start. This will greatly boost her farm and poultry yields thus increasing her income, which will enable her to provide for her basic needs such as food and clothing. 

Esther is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more quality fertilizer and more chicken

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Bourama  est emboucheur ovins, âgé de 51 ans, il  habite au Mali, marié et père  de deux enfants âgé de 1 à 15 ans dont un scolarisé. Il est celui qui a la main sur le bélier sur photo, sa femme est ménagère. IL exerce ce métier il y a 5 ans de cela, il s’approvisionne et vend ses animaux aux  marchés de sa localité. IL  sollicite  au près du RMCR un prêt pour  accroitre ses activités ovines, le bénéfice du prêt servira à  subvenir aux charges familiale soins sanitaire, habillement et autres. Après les ventes il peut réaliser un bénéfice de 30000FCFA. 
IL rêve d’être un grand emboucher dans la zone et utile pour la communauté.
texts.en:
Bourama practices sheep-fattening, is 51 years old, lives in Mali, is married and the father of 2 children aged 1 and 15, one of whom attends school. He is the one holding the ram in the photo. His wife is a cleaner. Bourama has been in this line of work for 5 years. He gets his animals and sells them at the local markets.

He is requesting a loan from RMCR in order to increase his sheep farming activities. The profits he earns will be used to meet his family's expenses, including health and clothing. After making his sales, he can have around 30 000 francs in profit. His dream is to practice large-scale livestock fattening in his area, and to be useful to his community.

loans.use: to buy animals to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Прекрасная женщина Гулнора. Она успешно погасила предыдущий кредит. Гулнора на протяжения 6 лет, на рынке продает детские одежды и обуви. Ее доходы только от этой деятельностью. Она старается ради ребенка, чтобы зарабатывать и обеспечить хорошую жилищную условию ребенка. Гулнора уверена в себе, что набрала хороший опыт и хочет продвигать бизнес на новый уровень. Она решила перевозить еще летнюю женскую одежду и расширить деятельность, она надеется с расширением бизнеса увеличиться доход. Гулнора с большими надеждами обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Gulnora is a beautiful woman. She successfully repaid her previous loan. Gulnora has sold children's clothing and shoes at the market for a period of six years. Her only income is from this business. She strives for the happiness of her child, earning money and providing good living conditions for it.

Gulnora is confident that she has gained good experience, and would like to take the business to a new level. She decided to import women's summer clothing and expand her business. She hopes expanding her business will increase her income. Gulnora applies for a loan with high hopes.

loans.use: to import clothing and expand her business

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Victor de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica  al  cultivo de maíz y maicillo posee 10 años de experiencia en la actividad, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Victor está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Victor is 38 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and son. He makes a living growing corn and sorghum and has 10 years experience in the business. He sells his products in different markets near his home and he uses the profits to pay some of the household expenses.

Victor is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc. and to improve his land, which is shown in the photograph, in order to continue his work and obtain a better income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc. and to improve his land.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela es una mujer de 44 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de escabeche y refresco.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, generosa, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la villa ‘1 de mayo’ que es un referente de historia y pujanza, Llena de edificios que denotan el emprendimiento de sus habitantes, la avenida principal de esta ciudadela que parece haber quedado pequeña para todo el desarrollo y crecimiento que se gesta en esta ciudadela, considerada la niña bonita de la ciudad. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Estela es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física delgada,  su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer, viven en un cuarto alquilado construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de escabeche y refresco; que consiste en conservar los alimentos en vinagre, y la técnica consiste en el precocinado mediante un caldo de vinagre, aceite frito, vino, laurel y pimienta en grano, “recuerdo cuando era niña que mi madre preparaba cerdo en escabeche, lo vendía, por trozos o enteros, también preparaba unas ensaladas deliciosas dejábamos el plato limpio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para la apertura de un snack. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de mesas y sillas para abrir un snack de escabeche en la puerta de su domicilio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 19 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Estela solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para abrir un snack de venta de escabeche.
texts.en:
Estela is a 44-year-old woman, she lives with her partner, without children, and her business is selling pickled foods and soft drinks.

She is enterprising, independent, generous, optimistic, responsible and very hard-working. Her business is located in the 1 de mayo area, which refers to history and strength, and is full of buildings that show the residents' businesses. The main avenue of this neighborhood, which seems to be too small for all the development and growth coming from this neighborhood, is considered the beautiful child of the city. It has a warm sub-tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Estela has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair she wears tied back, is short and has a thin physique. Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and the business she does. She shares her life with her partner who works as a driver. They live in a rented room built of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting and a cement floor which has running water, electricity and sewer services. Her business is selling pickled foods and soft drinks, she keeps the foods in vinegar and the technique consists of precooking it in a pot of vinegar, frying oil, wine, bay leaves, and peppercorns. "I remember when I was a girl that my mother made pickled pork, sold it in pieces and whole, and also made some delicious salads. We licked the plate clean..." she said. The advantage of her business is that she has daily sales. The disadvantage is the lack of investment capital to open a food stall. Her dream is to improve her business. She wants to purchase tables and chairs to open a stall selling pickled foods at the door of her house. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 19 years she has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Estela asks for a loan to purchase tables and chairs to open a stall selling pickled foods.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs to open a stall selling pickled foods.

loans.name: Yiriwaton Group

texts.fr:
Yaya  est emboucheur ovins, âgé de 31 ans il  habite au Mali, marié et père  de deux enfants âgé de 2 à 5 ans. Il est celui qui a la main sur le bélier sur photo, sa femme est ménagère. IL exerce ce métier il y a 3 ans de cela, il s’approvisionne et vend ses animaux aux  marchés de sa localité.
IL  sollicite  au près du RMCR un prêt pour accroitre ses activités ovines, le prêt servira à  subvenir aux charges familiale. 
IL rêve d’être un grand emboucher dans la zone et utile pour sa famille particulièrement ses enfants.
texts.en:
Yaya practices sheep-fattening, is 31 years old, lives in Mali, is married and the father of 2 children aged 2 and 5. He is the one holding the ram in the picture, his wife is a cleaner. He has been in his line of work for 3 years. He buys and sells his animals at his local markets.

He is requesting a loan from the RMCR in order to be able to expand his sheep-fattening activities and cover his family's expenses. He dreams of practicing large-scale livestock fattening in his area and of being helpful to his family, especially his children.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale.

loans.name: Rouby's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis juillet 2011,rassemble des membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Aissata qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est mariée,est âgée de 20 ans et mére de 02 garçons.

Son activité est le commerce de denrées alimentaires telles que le sucre,le riz,l'huile,le lait et le sucre.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 10 sacs de riz à 12500f le sac,02 bidons d'huile à 12500f le bidon,01 sac de sucre à 20000f et du lait pour 15000f.

Elle compte subvenir aux besoins de sa famille avec le bénéfice réalisé.
texts.en:
This group was created in July of 2011 and brings together people who live in the same village and are all small retailers.

Aissata, standing on the right of the picture and raising her hand, is the group representative. She is married, 20 years old and the mother of 2 boys. She sells foodstuffs like sugar, rice, oil, milk, and sugar. She plans to use her loan to buy 10 bags of rice (at 12 500 francs per bag), 2 cans of oil (at 12 500 francs per can), 1 bag of sugar (20 000 francs) and 15 000 francs worth of milk. She plans to meet her family's needs with the profit she makes.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, agua, jugos entre otros, su negocio esta ubicado en una zona muy transitado acerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería y así continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria, 44 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and son. 

She earns a living selling soft drinks, water, juices, etc. She has done this for ten years, setting up her vendor space in a high traffic zone near her home. She has many customers, and with the earnings from her work she is able to meet some of her household expenses.

Maria is applying for a loan to buy more goods to sell, as this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, water, juices, etc.

loans.name: Maria Dina

texts.es: Maria de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda y también se dedica a la venta pupusas, tiene varios años de dedicarse a esa actividad de las ventas de la cual ha podido salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, 46 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She has a store and also works selling pupusas. She has been doing this work for a number of years, which has allowed her to be able to get ahead. She is asking for a loan to be able to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc. and to be able to have more income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, refreshments, candies, sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Kisab Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Leah, 58 years old, with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.
 
She does farming of maize and potatoes. She gained knowledge through Hand in Hand training on enterprise start up and development. She is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers in order to increase her produce. 

This will improve her income and put her in a position to support her basic family needs.

Leah is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizers in order to increase her harvest.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge, de 41 años de edad, está acompañado, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, su esposa se dedica a los que hacerse diarios y sus hijos colaboran con los trabajos agrícolas.

Jorge, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para trabajar en los cultivos, aparte de la agricultura también se dedica a la recolección de materiales reciclables.

Jorge, desea trabajar mucho para que sus hijos se superen y tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Jorge, 41 years old, is partnered and lives with his wife and three children. His wife works in doing the daily chores and his children help with the farm work.

Jorge needs the loan to purchase farm supplies such as manure, pesticides, and herbicides to work the crops. Apart from agriculture, he also works collecting recyclable materials.

Jorge wants to work a lot so that his children improve themselves and have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, pesticides and herbicides to work his crops.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo es un padre  de familia con muchas metas y sueños que día con día lucha para salir adelante, él cuenta que gracias al crédito sus condiciones de vida han mejorado pues con el apoyo que recibió logro comprar su terreno y ahora ya cuenta con lugares más amplios donde poder cultivar sus hojas de maxán, con esta inversión sus condiciones de vida han mejorado, pero Lorenzo no es un hombre conformista por lo que ahora está dispuesto a seguir mejorado las condiciones de vida de su familia por tal razón solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar cuatro cuerdas de terreno para seguir ampliando  su cultivo de maxan.
Lorenzo guarda las esperanzas de seguir contando con su apoyo para hacer posible sus metas y sueños  para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lorenzo is a father with many goals and dreams who works hard on a daily basis to get ahead. He says that as a result of his previous loan his living conditions have improved, because with the support he received he managed to buy his own piece of land and he now has a bigger area in which to cultivate maxan leaves (used for wrapping tamales). His quality of life improved through that investment, but Lorenzo is not a conformist, and as a result he is now prepared to continue improving his family's quality of life. For this reason he is requesting another loan to buy four plots of land to further expand his crops of maxan. Lorenzo maintains his hopes for your continued support which make his goals and dreams for a better quality of life possible.

loans.use: to purchase four plots of land for agriculture

loans.name: Carmen Natalia

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 31 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 5 meses y 10 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Carmen para sacar adelante a su familia y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes, este negocio lo tiene ella desde hace cuatro años, gracias a la amabilidad con la que atiende su tienda Carmen cuenta con muchos clientes.
Carmen con el afán de mejorar su negocio y ofrecerle  a los clientes más y mejores productos, ella está solicitando un préstamo para poder adquirir un capital y comprar más productos de abarrotes como golosinas, azúcar, sal y gaseosas  para hacer de su tienda, una tienda con mejores productos.
El gran sueño de Carmen es poder construir una  casa más grande de block y darle a su familia una mejor  comodidad.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 31-year-old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family with three children between the ages of five months and ten years. This modest family lives in a community in Sololá.

To provide for her family and support her husband in paying for household expenses, Carmen buys and sells groceries for a living. She has had this business for four years and thanks to the friendly way she runs her store, Carmen has many clients.

In an effort to improve her business and to offer her customers more and better products, Carmen is requesting a loan to be able to acquire capital and buy more grocery products such as candy, sugar, salt and soft drinks to make her store into one that sells better products.

Carmen’s biggest dream is to be able to build a bigger house out of cinderblocks to give her family greater comfort.

loans.use: buy grocery products such as candy, sugar, salt and soft drinks.

loans.name: Yèrèdon Group

texts.fr:
Chaka est un  membre du groupe Yérédon, il est celui qui a la main sur le bœuf  dans la photo, gentil avec ses membres. Il fait l’embouche bovine, âgé de 48 ans, marié , il habite au Mali  et père de 7enfants, ses enfants sont âgés de 3ans à 21 ans dont(2) deux fréquentent l’école, son épouse est une ménagère.
Il  exerce ce métier il y a 8  ans, il s‘approvisionne et vend ses animaux au marchés de sa localité.
Pour insuffisance de fonds de roulement, il sollicite au près du RMCR pour avoir un prêt subséquent   pour  accroitre ses activités d’embouche, il lui  servira à  l’auto suffisante de la famille: santé, école, nourriture. Ses activités peuvent lui apporté un revenus de bénéfice de 25000 FCFA après ses ventes.il est souvent confronté au chute des prix.  
Son rêve c’est être automne et subvenir aux charges familiale.
texts.en:
Chaka is a sociable member of the Yérédon group and is the one with his hand on the bull in the picture. He practices cattle fattening, is 48 years old, married, lives in Mali and is the father of seven children aged between 3 and 21, two of whom currently attend school. His wife is a cleaner.

Chaka has been in this line of work for 8 years. He buys and sells his animals at the local markets. As he does not have enough working capital, he is requesting a subsequent loan from RMCR in order to increase his livestock-fattening activities. This will allow his family to be self-sufficient and cover expenses like health, education and food. His activities can make him up to 25 000 francs in profit once he has made his sales. He often has to face falling prices. His dream is to be independent and to cover his family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy cattle for later resale.

loans.name: Nyasha

texts.en:
Nyasha is a 30-year-old single mother of one living in Chikomba West, a district in Zimbabwe. 

She provides counseling services to young people facing challenges at a local community center. Nyasha also inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur. She currently operates a grocery shop where she sells food items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationery. 

She hopes to get another Kiva loan so that she further expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 39-year-old lady, married and a mother of five children, who are attending school. 

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2013 to benefit from training, especially enterprise development and financial management.

She practices dairy and vegetable farming and also operates a food cafe to supplement her income. She is borrowing again from Kiva to buy animal feeds to increase milk production and hence earn more income to enable her pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and all its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds to increase milk production and hence earn more income to enable her to pay school fees for her two children.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es el taller de tapicería.
Él es emprendedor, activo, optimista, generoso, responsable y muy trabajador. su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘16 de julio’ caracterizada por su feria; considerada las más grande del país, donde se puede encontrar desde un alfiler hasta un tractor agrícola. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Javier es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la tapicería; que se trata de cubrir con tela o cualquier material, asientos domésticos, de automóviles, motocicletas o barcos, fijando el material con tachuelas o grapas, mejorando la comodidad de los mismos instalando muelles, espumas o fibras vegetales en su interior, “Todos los tapiceros que conozco han aprendido el oficio desde abajo, yo entré muy joven como ayudante en un taller de tapicería y a base de trabajar con los años me independicé y aún después de 7 años de oficio todavía sigo aprendiendo...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de materia prima como; madera, tapiz, cuero y otros. Su sueño es abrir una empresa de tapicería, el desea realizar la compra de material de trabajo para su tapicería. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Javier solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de tapicería para su negocio y con los beneficios crear una empresa.
texts.en:
Javier is 33 years old. He lives with his partner and they don't have any children. He has an upholstery workshop.  Javier is enterprising, active, optimistic, generous, responsible and very hardworking. His business is located in the '16 de julio' area which is known for its market, considered the country's largest, where you can find everything from a pin to an agricultural tractor. The weather is cold and dry, with temperatures during the day varying between 0 and 12 degrees celsius.

Javier has dark complexion, brown eyes, short black hair, and is of short, slight build. His mother tongue is Aymara, which he speaks at home and he also speaks Spanish because of his culture and his work. He shares his life with his partner, who is engaged in the same activity. They live in their own home built of brick and cement with a tin roof and wooden floor. It has running water, electricity, domestic gas and a sewerage system. 

He makes a living from upholstery, which involves covering household chairs, and car, motorcycle and boat seats with fabric or other materials, and then fixing the material with tacks or staples. The level of comfort is improved by placing springs, foam or vegetable fibers inside. "All the upholsterers I know have learned the trade from the bottom. I started very young as an assistant in a upholstery shop and after a few years experience in this work I set up my own business. Even after seven years of it I'm still learning," he says. The advantage of his business is that he always has customers. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy raw materials such as wood, tapestry, and leather. His dream is to set up a larger upholstery company. He wishes to buy work materials for his upholstery shop. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution that he has taken in the seven years he has been in this business.
For these reasons Javier is requesting a loan to purchase upholstery materials for his business and he will use the proceeds to set up a larger company.

loans.use: to purchase upholstery materials for his business, with the goal of using the profits to set up a larger business.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is 35 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 2 and 10 years, 3 of them go to school. She owns a shop and she has been in  business for 10 years. Her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and salt for selling. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In future, she aims to earn at least 500,000 per month

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and salt for selling in her shop

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is a thirty-six-year-old single woman with four school going children. They live in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been selling natural salt for eleven years, this being the main business for people living around Lake Katwe. She now needs a loan to buy more salt to sell. 

Allen maintains her family and business dreams of educating her children to university level, and to expand her business respectively despite the challenge of unpredictable weather changes and lack of protected gears to salt miners.

loans.use: to buy more natural salt to sell.

loans.name: Ia

texts.en:
Ia is married and lives with her husband in the Akhmeta district, East Georgia. The family is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow maize and sell the harvest locally. 

Ia wants to open a bakery and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan to open a bakery. As the bakery is opened she will bake Georgian bread to sell. This will give her a stable income. Ia hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a bakery to produce traditional Georgian bread

loans.name: Mougnoussin Group

texts.fr:
Virginie est une femme ménagère âgée de 42 ans. C’est elle qui tient la corde du mouton. Elle vit avec son mari et ses 6 enfants dont 3 sont écoliers âgés de 19 à 2 ans. Elle n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école ; c’est pourquoi elle s’est lancée dans l’élevage des moutons. Elle rêve avoir plus d’argent pour acheter des moutons et espère pouvoir aider son mari dans la prise en charges de sa famille.
Virginie se plait avec l’élevage des moutons qu’elle fait depuis 6 ans parce qu’elle y gagne sa vie.
Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés voisins de sa zone et revend dans les mêmes marchés où elle peut faire un bénéfice prévisionnel d’un montant de 60 000FCFA.   
Les obstacles auxquels elle fait face sont plus souvent les maladies de bétails et aussi des vols à domicile.
texts.en:
Virginie is a housewife who is 42 years old. She is the one holding onto the sheep. She lives with her husband and 6 children aged between 2 and 19, 3 of whom attend school. She did not get the opportunity to get an education which is why she got into sheep farming. She dreams of having more money with which to buy sheep and hopes to be able to support her husband with the family expenses.

Virginie likes being a sheep farmer, which she has been for 6 years, because it allows her to make a living. She gets her supplies at the markets in neighbouring areas and resells at the same markets, where she can make a potential profit of 60 000 francs. The challenges she has to face are most often livestock illnesses as well as robberies at her home.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale.

loans.name: Comfort Traders Group

texts.en:
Juliana is a member and a group representative of comfort traders from Mankessim in the Mfantsiman District of the Central Region of Ghana. Juliana is 64 years old and married with 3 children. She has only 1 of her children who is still in school.

Juliana is a trader and sells shoes, sandals,polythene bags, rubber sandals and local soap within her local market. Juliana wishes to have her store expanded in five years time and also introduce selling of second-hand clothes to increase her customer base and income levels. Juliana has grown her business over the years with micro loan support from the Field Partner. 

Juliana has been faithful in the repayments of all her previous 9 loan cycles. Her main challenge now is how to increase her stock level to be able to meet the customers' demand. Juliana needs additional working capital support to enable her buy shoes, sandals, polythene bags and local soap for resale. This  will enable Juliana to increase her sales to save some money to support the husband cater for the family and re-invest the rest into the business. Juliana thanks all her Kiva lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: To buy shoes, sandals, and polythene bags and local soap for resale

loans.name: Ezechiel

texts.en: Ezechiel is 35 years old. He is married with one child age of  2 year, who is too young to school. He sells meat and has been in a business for the past 4 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more meat for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In future, he wishes to earn at least 100,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more meat for sale.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
Marceline is 36 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 2 and 9 years; two of them go to school. Marceline owns a shop and she has been in business for 5 years, while her husband is a driver. 

With the loan, she would like to buy items such as rice, lotion and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children. In future she wishes to earn at least 100,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy items such as rice, lotion and sugar to sell, to help pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en:
Emerthe is 49 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 3 and 22 years, the younger ones all go to school. She owns a bar and she been in business for 2 years and her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beer for selling. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings. In future, she wishes to earn at least 250,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more beer for sale at her bar.

loans.name: Jacoba

texts.es:
Jacoba, de 29 años de edad, estudio bachillerato opción secretariado, cuando termino sus estudios comenzó a buscar trabajo pero no encontró, está casada y su esposo trabaja como ordenanza una alcaldía, tiene dos hijas de 5 y 1 año de edad, en su casa vive su esposo y sus hijas, pero la vivienda está construida en el terreno de sus padres, así que son vecinos de ellos. 

Jacoba, se dedica a impartir clases cristianas en una iglesia que está en la comunidad donde vive, con esa enseñanza pretenden que los niños crezcan teniendo una buena educación y no busquen grupos delictivos; antes de dedicarse a esto, ella se dedicaba a los oficios del hogar y a trabajar en una cooperativa cortando y abonando café.- El lugar donde trabaja actualmente está a 30 minutos de su casa y su horario de trabajo es de 9:00 a.m. hasta las 12:00 del mediodía y de 1:00 p.m. a 4:00 p.m.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar abonos, herbicidas y fungicidas, para preparar sus cultivos de maíz, ya que es el tiempo ideal para hacerlo, con esta ayuda asegurara una buena producción de granos, de la cual podrán vender una parte y la otra la dejará para el consumo de su familia. 

En un futuro desea poder construir un cuarto más en su casa, para que sus hijas tengan más espacio y mejor calidad de vida; también desea poder ayudarles para que estudien la carrera que más les guste.
texts.en:
Jacoba is 29 years old and has a diploma in secretarial studies. When she finished her studies she began looking for work but could not find any. She is married and her husband works as an orderly in a municipal office. She has two daughters, one and five years old. Her husband and daughters live with her, but the house is built on her parents’ land and they are their neighbours.

Jacoba’s job is teaching Christian classes at a church in her community. She hopes that with this teaching, the children will grow up with good moral education and not seek out criminal groups. Before she began this work, Jacoba looked after household duties and worked in a co-op cutting and fertilizing coffee. Now, her workplace is 30 minutes away from her home and her workday is 9:00 a.m. to 12:00 noon and 1:00 p.m. to 4:00 p.m.

She needs this loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides and fungicides to prepare her corn crops, as it is now the ideal time to do so. With this help she will be sure of good grain production, part of which she will be able to sell and the rest of which will be left for her family to eat.

In the future, Jacoba wishes to be able to build another room in her house so that her daughters can have more space and a better quality of life. She would also like to be able to help them so that they can study the subjects they like the most.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and fungicides to prepare her corn crops.

loans.name: Neli

texts.en:
Neli is a 61-year-old widow from the village of Mleta. She lives alone and earns a living with a pension from the local government. 

Neli finds it hard to tackle financial difficulties as she has no source of significant income. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. She decided to start an agribusiness with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Neli’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. 

She received the credit within the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Startup Program gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  

Neli will buy a dairy cow and start producing milk products. She will sell the products at the local market. This will give Neli a chance to earn income and become financially independent. With the Start Up Program she will be able to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and start selling milk products.

loans.name: Tupendane Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Margaret, a member of Tupendane Women group. She is 65 years old, married, and has six children.

She practices vegetables, maize and beans farming. Having undergone Hand in Hand training on enterprise development and financial management, she learnt how to draw her budget and plan well for the future. 

She is borrowing a loan from Kiva, with which she intends to purchase fertilizer and seeds. This will help expand her farming activities and hence boost her earnings so as to support the family and sustain the agribusiness.
  
She is much grateful to Kiva for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds that will help boost output to help meet family needs.

loans.name: Ana

texts.fr: Ana est une femme mariée qui vit dans le quartier de Baguida. Agée de 35 ans, Ana est mère de trois enfants et vend de l’eau et du jus glacé pour contribuer à leur épanouissement. Grace à son dynamisme Ana  arrive à vendre et trouve son gain nécessaire dans ce commerce. Ana s’approvisionne une fois par mois et demande ce crédit pour acheter des sachets d’eau et du jus. Ana souhaite tirer plus de bénéfice et favoriser l’éducation e ses enfants.
texts.en: Ana is a married woman who lives in the district of Baguida. Ana is 35 years old and the mother of 3 children. She sells iced water and juice so that she can contribute to her children's development. Thanks to her dynamism, Ana manages to sell her wares and to earn sufficient profits with her business. Ana gets her supplies once a month and is requesting this loan to buy packs of water and juice. Ana would like to earn more profits and to prioritise her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 100 packs of water and 32 of juice.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 24 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 1 and 4 years, who do not yet go to school. 

She owns a shop and she has been in business for 5 years. Her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and salt for selling in her shop. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In future, she aims to earn at least 600,000 per month

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and salt for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for farm transportation.

loans.name: Maria Venancia

texts.es:
María, de 68 años de edad, solo tuvo 2 hijos los cuales viven en su casa con sus respectivas esposas e hijos, que se dedican a la agricultura.

María, tiene más de 40 años de dedicarse a la producción agrícola junto a sus 2 hijos, específicamente se han dedicado a sembrar maíz y frijol para posteriormente comercializarlo.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para que la cosecha sea productiva y preparar la tierra con anticipación.

María, desea que la cosecha de buenos resultados y que sus hijos puedan venderla y obtener el mayor provecho para poder comprar un molino y generar ingresos adicionales.
texts.en:
María is 68 years old and only had two children, who live with her in her house with their respective wives and children, who work in agriculture.

María has worked in agricultural production for more than 40 years together with her two children. Specifically, they sow corn and beans for commercial use.

María needs this loan to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides to prepare the land ahead of time to ensure a productive harvest.

María hopes the harvest will produce good results and wants her children to be able to sell it and get the most out of it to be able to buy a mill and generate additional income.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides to prepare the land ahead of time to ensure a productive harvest.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
En el año 2012 por necesidad económica y buscando tener independencia económica Luz Marina inicio con un negocio de venta de mercancía textil (Ropa).

Luz Marina quiere solicitar un préstamo para tener una nueva línea de venta,  será calzado con la que espera obtener mayores ingresos y aumentar su número de clientes.

El préstamo le permitirá seguir consolidando su independencia económica y luchar por su sueño de comprar una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
In 2012, for financial reasons and looking to gain economic independence, Luz Marina started a business selling dry goods (clothing).
Luz Marina wants to request a loan to have a new line of sales, which would be footwear. She hopes to obtain a better income and increase her number of customers.
The loan will permit her to continue to consolidate her economic independence and fight for her dream of buying her own home.

loans.use: to buy quantities of footwear

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is 52 years old, from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. He lives with his wife and is the only breadwinner in the family. Gia is a hard-working and motivated man, who does his best to make good living conditions for his family. He works hard on building activities and also works as a taxi driver in his free time.

Gia wants to make another source of income for his family's welfare and renovate the house for further renting. He needs financial support to purchase a stock of building materials to renovate his house. Then he will rent it and get some income. 

Gia has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Gia and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life. 

Gia is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate additional income.

loans.use: To renovate his house, to be able to rent it out for a more stable income

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Akoko est âgée de 46 ans et vit à Baguida. Mariée, Akoko a quatre enfants à sa charge et travaille dynamiquement pour leur permettre une bonne condition de vie. Akoko vend des denrées alimentaires et des tomates fraiches au marché afin de réaliser une bonne marge de bénéfice. Akoko s’approvisionne six fois par mois au marché de Lomé. Pour acheter des paniers de tomates fraiches, Akoko demande ce prêt pour réaliser son objectif et gagner un profit pour favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Akoko is 46 years old and lives in Baguida. Akoko is married and has 4 dependent children. She works hard to ensure that they have good living conditions. Akoko sells food, including fresh tomatoes, at the market in order to earn a good profit margin. Akoko gets her supplies 6 times a month at the Lomé market. Akoko is requesting this loan to buy baskets of fresh tomatoes and to realise her objective of making a profit which she can use to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 2 baskets of fresh tomatoes.

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Aminah is 65 years old, married and blessed with six children. 

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and gained more skills in enterprise development and financial management. This helped her improve her knowledge of business management.

Aminah has been doing dairy farming for the past two years. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fodder for her cows and also start a poultry business since demand for chicken is high. This will lead to more income and thus provide her family with food and the ability to meet household expenses.

Aminah appreciates Kiva and its lenders for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fodder for cows and chickens to start poultry farming. This will improve income and allow her to meet family needs with ease.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 37 years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

Rebecca practices dairy farming. She has undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, which has enabled her acquire skills in enterprise and value-chain management. 

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase dairy feeds for her cows. This will translate to more milk production, thus increasing her income, which she will use to educate her children, provide medical care and other family needs comfortably.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds for dairy cows that will help boost milk production and thus income.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is a single mother of one. She resides in the Chiredzi . She repaid her $500 loan very well. Her poultry business is running well.  

Now she needs a second Kiva loan for her to further expand her hardware business. Abigail aspires to employ more people and to expand her business. She wants to improve her homestead into a decent home with a big and nutritious garden, as well as a toilet for good sanitation.

She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at schools in her community. The goal of a Camfed Learner Guide is to help boost the academic achievement of students in local high schools and teach life skills

loans.use: To purchase more hardware stock like fertilisers, feeds and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a sachet water business, in addition to tailoring

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en:
Munavvar, age 54, is a wonderful woman and the single mother of one son.  She lives with her son in the city of Tursunzoda.  Because of the family's difficult situation, her son works as a handyman.  Munavvar herself works as a seamstress and sews traditional Tajik outfits.

Munavvar has been thinking about renovating her home for several years already because her house lacks all amenities, which makes life very difficult.  For this reason, she is taking a loan as she doesn't have enough money to buy the building materials to renovate her house.  She relies entirely on your help.

loans.use: to renovate her home.

loans.name: Didacienne

texts.en:
Dedaciene is a 30 year old mother with two children who are aged 2 and 4 years. With the previous loan, she bought shoes to sell and she has been in business for 7 years. 

With the profits, together with this loan, she plans to buy food stuffs to sell, which include beans and sorghum. From the sales, she will have profits with which she plans to make some savings and be able to enlarge her capital to ten million in the future.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs to sell, which include beans and sorghum.

loans.name: Edwin Stiv

texts.es:
Con su trabajo de transporte de persona, Edwin consigue el sustento para su familia.

Trabaja todos los días durante 5 horas para poder prestar un muy buen servicio a los habitantes del municipio de Argelia.

El solicita un préstamo con la Corporación Interactuar con cual podrá realizar el mantenimiento a su motocicleta.

Esto le permitirá tener un vehículo en muy buenas condiciones sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la de sus clientes.
texts.en:
In his job transporting people, Edwin manages to support his family.
He works for 5 hours every day to be able to offer a very good service to the residents of the town of Argelia.
He is requesting a loan with the Corporación Interactuar with which he would carry out maintenance on his motorbike.
This will permit him to have a vehicle in very good condition so that he doesn't put any of his customers' lives at risk.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance on his motorbike

loans.name: Pipeline Stable Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Jane, a member of Pipeline Stable group in Nakuru, Kenya. She is a mother of six children and is taking care of one grandchild. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in April 2014.

Jane is a maize, beans and dairy farmer. She is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for the enterprise training that has enabled her to pursue farming as a business, unlike before when she practiced subsistence farming. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase seeds and fertilizers that will help boost profits. From the anticipated income, she will be able to provide family needs such as food and education for her grandchild.

Jane is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers that will help boost profits to provide family needs such as food and education for her grandchild.

loans.name: Davlyat

texts.ru: 57 летный дехканин Давлят. Он житель района Чиликул. Давлят 30 лет работает на земле. Он занимается земледелием. Еще он занимается животноводством. Он арендует большую часть землю для бизнеса. Он в этом году выращивает хлопок. Работать на земле нелегко, земледелие это тяжелая работа, но Давлят уже опытный и он с утра до вечера проводят время на земле. Ему в работе помогает его сыновья. Давлят просит кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений для обработки землю, чтобы убить насекомые и получить богатый урожай. Он нуждается на поддержку.
texts.en:
This 57-year-old farmer is called Davlyat. He lives in the Jiligul region and has been working the land for 30 years. He works both in agriculture and in animal husbandry. He rents a large piece of land for his business and is growing cotton this year. Farming isn't easy and cultivating the land is hard work, but he is experienced and from morning to evening spends his days on the land. His sons help him with this work.

Davlyat is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizer to amend the soil, in order to kill the insects and receive a good harvest. He needs this support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la elaboración de  antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc. que vende de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza ha logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maíz para los tamales, plátanos y todos los ingredientes para su elaboración y así poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en: Rosa, 44 years old, lives in her own house with her family. She works making snacks such as fried potatoes, fried yucca, empanadas, tamales, etc., which she sells as a street vendor near her home. Thanks to the sales she makes, she has managed to cover some of the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to purchase products that she uses in making her snacks such as oil, potatoes, corn for the tamales, plantains and all the ingredients to make them and, so, to be able to continue supporting her household and be able to cover the costs that can come up.

loans.use: to purchase oil, potatoes, corn for the tamales, plantains and all the ingredients.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El trabajo del campo es una de las labores más difíciles hoy en día por el gran esfuerzo que se debe hacer para progresar, pero Carlos es un hombre que nunca se ha rendido a pesar del clima o las circunstancias que puedan pasar, el siempre está dispuesto a conseguir los recursos necesarios para su familia.

Se levanta desde primera hora de la mañana para desplazarse a distintas fincas para cumplir con sus obligaciones laborales como jornalero.

Este oficio lo alterna con la venta de leche que obtiene de sus propias vacas.
 
El desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para garantizar el sostenimiento de sus negocios y es esta la razón que lo lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de dos vacas lecheras que le den un buen impulso a su negocio.
texts.en:
Working in the fields is one of the most difficult jobs nowadays because of the great effort you need to put forth in order to progress.  However, Carlos is a man who never gives up in spite of the weather or the circumstances that can occur.  He is always ready to get the resources that his family needs.

He gets up in the early morning to go to the different farms to fulfill his work obligations as a day worker.  He alternates this work with selling milk that he gets from his own cows.

He wishes to increase his work capital to guarantee that he can sustain his businesses.  This is the reason that he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of two dairy cows that will give his business a good boost.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Grupo Las Conquistadoras Tzanjuyup Group

texts.es:
Maria  (es la primera del lado izquierdo de blusa negra) es una madre de familia que ama y protege a sus hijos, ella cuenta que antes no contaba con el apoyo de nadie es por ello que le era muy difícil superarse, pero ahora gracias al crédito ella pudo comprar sus materiales como hilos y elaborar los mejores trajes típicos de su región, maría gracias al esmero que le dedica a su trabajo ahora ya cuenta con mucho más clientes  y sus ingresos han mejorado mucho, pero María no es una mujer conformista sino todo lo contrario llena de optimista y con el afán de seguir prosperando Maria junto a su grupo solicita un nuevo préstamo  para seguir comprando mercadería como güipiles, cortes y fajas y seguir ofreciéndole a los clientes buenos productos.
María tiene el anhelo de comprar un terreno para poder tener donde cultivar.
texts.en:
Maria (the first on the left in the black shirt) is a mother who loves and protects her children. She says that before she didn't have the support of anyone,so it was difficult to improve herself. But now, thanks to the loan, she was able to purchase materials such as thread and make the best traditional clothing of her region. Thanks to the care that she puts into her work, María now has many more customers and her income has increased a lot, but María is not a woman who settles, instead she is full of optimism and eagerness to continue prospering. Maria, with her group, asks for another loan to continue purchasing merchandise such as güipiles [traditional tops], cortes [traditional skirts] and sashes and continue offering good products to the customers.

María has a desire to purchase a plot of land to have a place where she can grow crops.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
Lisbeth es una mujer de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo recién nacido de 5 meses, y su negocio es la venta de haba y maní.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, decidida, constante, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona sur de la ciudad, caracterizado por el comercio informal y por la manufactura independiente. De clima de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Lisbeth es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física mediana,  su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer y con su bebé que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construida de madera, ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración de maní y haba en bolsita; Las habas son una de las legumbres más populares del altiplano, reúne todas las condiciones para ser un hit por su sabor y por su originalidad. Para su elaboración se debe secar las habas y el maní en un horno para luego embolsarlo agregarle sal y comercializarlo, “las habas secas son un alimento rico en potasio y ayudan a la circulación, regulando la presión arterial por lo que es un alimento beneficioso para personas que sufren hipertensión…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus productos son populares, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos para la elaboración, como: habas, maní, gas, sal, y otros. Su sueño es abrir una tienda, ella desea realiza la compra de insumos para la elaboración de su mercadería. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lisbeth solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de maní y haba y con los beneficios comprar leche para su bebé.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is a 25-year-old woman who lives with her partner. She has a five-month-old newborn and her business is selling broad beans and peanuts.

She is a good mother, enterprising, determined, tenacious, patient, responsible and very hardworking. She is developing her business in the southern zone of the city, which is characterized by small businesses and independent manufacturing. The area has a warm, sub-tropical climate with temperatures ranging between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius throughout the day.

Lisbeth has a dark complexion, brown eyes and long black hair that she usually wears tied at the back of her neck. She is short-statured with a medium build. Her first language is Guaraní, which she speaks at home, and she speaks Spanish in everyday life and in her business. She shares her life with her partner, who works as a chauffeur, and with her baby, who is not yet of school age. They live in a rented room made of wood, brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof and dirt floor. They have drinking water, electricity and plumbing.

Lisbeth’s business is the production of bagged peanuts and broad beans. Broad beans are one of the most popular legumes of the Altiplano, bringing together all the necessary elements for a hit with their flavour and originality. For her production, Lisbeth must dry the beans and peanuts in an oven and later bag them, add salt and finally sell them. “Dried broad beans are a food rich in potassium that helps with circulation and regulating blood pressure, which is why they are a beneficial food for people suffering from hypertension,” she adds.

The advantage of Lisbeth’s business is that her products are popular; the disadvantage is that she lacks the capital to buy supplies for her production. These include the beans, peanuts, fuel, salt, and more. Her dream is to open a store and she wishes to buy supplies for the production of her merchandise. This is her first series of loans with this institution in the seven years she has been developing this business.

These are the reasons that Lisbeth is requesting a loan to buy supplies for the sale and production of peanuts and broad beans, and with the profits, she will buy milk for her baby.

loans.use: buy supplies for the sale and production of peanuts and broad beans, and with the profits, buy milk for her baby.

loans.name: Drocelle

texts.en:
Drocelle is 27 years old. She is married with two children aged between 2 and 5 years who are too young to school. She sells foodstuffs and she has been in a business for the past 3 years. While her husband is a businessman. With the loan, he would like to buy items such as cassava, sorghum and bananas for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In future, she wishes to earn at least 200,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy items such as cassava, sorghum and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 55 year-old Isatu. She is married and has 1 child aged 22yrs.

In 2000, Isatu established her frozen fish business. She began her business because because her husband could not provide for all their needs. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are the general community. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Isatu requires the loan in order to buy fifty cartons of frozen fish for resale,. She hopes that this loan will support her and she plans to be in the programme until she becomes a supplier of fish to the other fishmongers.

In the future, Isatu plans to build her own shop and empower her children to become educated to university level so they can take good care of her in her old age.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy fifty cartons of frozen fish for resale.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
This is 59 year-old Musu. She is married and has 6 children aged 39, 37, 35, 34, 32, and 26.

In 2010, Musu established her grocery business. She began her business because her parents were business people, and she took after them. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are the general community. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,900,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Musu requires a loan in order to buy more bags of rice, oil, sardines and luncheon meat. She hopes that this loan will help her to carter for more customers which will result in the business expanding.

In the future, Musu plans to build her own shop and empower her children to take good care of her in her old age. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, oil, sardines and luncheon meat.

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane is 26 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 3 and 4 years . She sells clothes and she has been in business for the past 5 years. Her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for selling. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children. In future, she aims to earn at least 300,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale, to help pay school fees

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is 45 years old and she is married with 2 children, aged 6 and 7years, they both go to school. 

She sells foodstuffs and she has been in a business for 10 years. Her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, sorghum and local juices for selling. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings. In future, she wishes to earn at least 150,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum and local juices for sale

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es:
Claudia intenta ganarse la vida día a día con una cafetería que inicio hace algunos meses. Con este negocio sostiene sus gastos y vela por el bienestar de su madre.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido como snacks, bebidas e ingredientes para la preparación de pasteles y empanadas.

A su negocio le dedica aproximadamente unas 7 horas diaria y debe enfrentar dificultades como la competencia y el alto costo de los insumos, pero siempre tiene presente su gran sueño de poder tener una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Claudia tries to earn her daily living with a cafe that she opened a few months ago. With this business, she pays her expenses and takes care of her mother's well-being.

Currently, she is asking for a loan to purchase an assortment such as snacks, drinks and ingredients to make cakes and empanadas.

She works approximately 7 hours a day at her business and has to face difficulties such as the competition and the high cost of supplies, but she always thinks about her big dream of being able to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment such as snacks, drinks and ingredients to make cakes and empanadas.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Ser la única vendedora grande de mercancía de productos de consumo personal, es una gran ventaja para sacar su negocio adelante, además de ser una promotora de la vida saludable es ideal para que Marisol prospere y se anime a triunfar en el emprendimiento y en el difícil mercado. 

Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital para comprar mercancía y por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar productos de uso personal como desodorantes, lociones, cremas, y algo de vestuario, de este modo impulsar el uso de estos productos entre sus conocidos y gente del barrio donde vive.
