Su principal sueño es tener un negocio estable, un local comercial, mejorar ventas, y que este negocio le dé estabilidad económica y lo suficiente para cubrir sus necesidades y las de sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
To be the only big seller of personal products is a big advantage to get her business ahead, in addition being a promoter of the healthful lifestyle is ideal so that Marisol prospers and motivates herself to triumph in the undertaking and in a difficult market. 

Her principal difficulty is the lack of capital to purchase merchandise and for this she wants to ask for a loan to purchase personal care products such as deodorants, lotions, creams, and some wardrobe items, in this way to boost the use of these products among her acquaintances and people in the neighborhood where she lives.

Her principal dream is to have a stable business, a retail space, improve her sales, and that the business gives her economic stability and enough to cover her needs and those of her two children.

loans.use: to purchase personal products such as deodorants, lotions, creams and some wardrobe items.

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Tuzzmurane is a group led by Janviere who is 30 years old. The group name means “Support Each Other” in English.

Janviere is married with 2 children aged 4 and 7 years. She owns a restaurant and has been in business for the past 2 years. The group members sell different items but they have the same idea for changing their lives. With the loan, she would like to buy more meat, bananas, beans and cassava to make more food to sell.

The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more meat, bananas, beans and cassava to make more food to sell.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is from small village called Ereda. She has a little child and husband, who has a fixed salary about 400 GEL per month. This is the only source of existence for the family. Nana wants to help her poor family's welfare and start her own activity. 

She decided to start dairy farming and seek credit among local financial institutions to purchase a cow. She couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions, because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows the rural poor like Nana to get a chance for starting or re-starting a business. Nana will start milking the cow and produce dairy-products for local sales. 

This will give her a chance to earn an income and become financially independent. With the Start Up program Nana will be able to generate income and provide a better future for her family members.

loans.use: To start dairy farming and making her own income

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, de 77 años de edad, es viuda, tuvo 2 hijas que actualmente viven con ella junto a sus hijos.

Lucia, toda la vida se a dedicado a sembrar granos básicos, pero siempre a trabajado con jornaleros para la siembra y mantenimiento de sus cultivos de maíz y frijol.

El dinero lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas como herbicidas y fertilizantes, para darle buen manejo a los cultivos y tener mejor producción.

Sus planes son, seguir trabajando y ayudarles a sus hijas mientras pueda.
texts.en:
Lucia, 77 years old, is a widow. She had two daughters who currently live with her, along with their children. 

Lucia has worked her whole life growing basic grains, but she has always worked with day laborers to plant and maintain her crops of corn and beans.

The money is needed to purchase agricultural supplies such as herbicides and fertilizers to give good care to the crops and have better production. 

Her plans are to continue working and help her daughters while she can.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as herbicides and fertilizers to give good care to the crops and have better production.

loans.name: Andrino

texts.en:
Andrino works hard to support her family. Andrino is married and has a seaweeds cultured business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seaweeds seedlings, rope, etc.

Andrino has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Andrino would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed seedlings, rope, etc

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 40 years old and married with three children, two of whom in school, Emma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Emma has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Agness. She is married and has 3 children aged 20, 15 and 9yrs.

In 2009, Agness established her grocery shop business. She began her business because she could not find a job, and so she decided to engage in business. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are the general community. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 9,000,00 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Agness requires a loan in order to buy cartons of luncheon meat, drinks, sardines, milk, etc. for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her to cater to more customers which will result in the business expanding.

In the future, Agness plans to educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of luncheon meat, drinks, sardines, milk, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Lina

texts.en:
Ma. Lina is 40 years old, married with three children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of households goods to sell.

Ma. Lina has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Ma. Lina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of households goods to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Marites is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas and his family live in a rural home in Kiringa village in Kenya. His wife and 2 children love dairy farming for the milk they get for food and income. He started dairy farming 9 years ago and now he has 1 cow, 2 goats, 15 heads of poultry, 30 trees and a garden full of maize and banana crops. He sells his produce at the local market which offer very low prices.  

Through hard work and sacrifices, he has been able to grow his dairy farm over the years. He is seeking a loan that will enable him get past the local market and into the formal market. Douglas is seeking a loan to purchase a motorcycle that he will use to ferry his farm produce to distant formal markets.
Your loan investment will create more opportunities for Douglas to grow his business and networks: This will have a positive change on his business and financial trajectory.

Income from this investment will be used by Douglas to clear his loan obligation and provide for the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for farm products transportation

loans.name: Irine

texts.fr:
Irine has a small farm in Sigowet village where she lives and farms with her family. She is a small scale cash crop producer who sells her produce at a local market near her home. She started farming many years ago and through the years, she has learnt the important role of quality farm inputs in the production of food and meeting of customers' needs. 
The biggest growth constraint for Irine is lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs that control weeds and pests. 
With your lending, Irine will be able access capital to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity and family income.
texts.en:
Irine has a small farm in Sigowet village where she lives and farms with her family. She is a small scale cash crop producer who sells her produce at a local market near her home. She started farming many years ago and through the years, she has learnt the important role of quality farm inputs in the production of food and meeting of customers' needs. 

The biggest growth constraint for Irine is lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs that control weeds and pests. 
With your lending, Irine will be able access capital to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity and family income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds for better yield

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 37 year-old Isatu. She is married and has 4 children aged 22, 17, 6 and 3 yrs.

In 2013, Isatu established her frozen fish business. She began her business because she had no formal education so she decided to engage business to be self employed. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are the general community. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 19,000,00 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy an additional forty (40) cartons of frozen fish for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her to cater for more customers which will result in the business expanding.

In the future, Isatu plans to be a supplier of frozen to other fishmongers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional forty (40) cartons of frozen fish for resale

loans.name: Monique

texts.en: Monique is 30 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 1 and 4 years. She sells clothes and she has been in business for the past 2 years. Her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sell. T200,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Gbassay

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Gbassay. She is married and has four children, ages 22, 18, 5 and 3. In 2013, Gbassay established her grocery shop selling rice, cooking oil, pure drinking water and provisions. She began her business because she was trained in business and wanted to assist her husband educating the children. Her business is located on the outskirts of the city and her main customers are the general community. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

Gbassay would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to buy more bags of rice, gallons of cooking oil, soft drinks and some provisions for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her to serve more customers and, as a result, the business will expand. In the future, Gbassay plans to educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, gallons of cooking oil, etc., for her grocery store

loans.name: Suliaman

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Suliaman. He is married and has four children, aged 16, 14, 12 and 2 years. In 2001, Suliaman established his transportation business.  He began his business because he had no other choice; he couldn't continue his education because of financial constraints, so he embarked on transportation. 

His business is located in the outskirts of the city, and his main customers are men and women. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 6,000,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Suliaman requires a new loan in order to buy spare parts for his vehicle. He hopes that this loan will help his vehicle to raise money again, and thereby increase the profit.  

In the future, Suliaman plans to buy another vehicle. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Doris Maria

texts.es:
Una pequeña salsamentaria fue lo que con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar esta emprendedora mujer de 36 años de edad llamada Doris, que buscando una alternativa para generar ingresos tuvo esta maravillosa idea. 

Hoy en día por el alto costo de los insumos, su negocio está viéndose afectado, pues está perdiendo algunos clientes. 

Solicita un apoyo crediticio en la Corporación Interactuar para tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para invertirlo en la compra de sillas, mesas, una mesa de billar, adecuación de una cancha de tejo y bebidas.

Espera lograr superar esta crisis y gozar en un futuro al lado de su esposo y sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
A small shop was what, with a lot of effort, this enterprising 36-year-old woman named Doris was able to open, seeking an alternative to earn income and having this marvelous idea. 

These days, due to the high cost of supplies, her business is being affected, since she is losing some customers.

She asks for a loan from Corporación Interactuar to have sufficient working capital to invest it in chairs, tables, a pool table, and to set up a tejo [traditional Colombian sport] court and drinks.

She hopes to be able to overcome this crisis and enjoy a future at the side of her husband and their two children.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and tables, a pool table, and to set up a tejo [traditional Colombian sport] court and drinks

loans.name: Janet Del Carmen

texts.es:
Janet es una mujer emprendedora, que desde muy joven inicio a trabajar, vendiendo mercadería como ropa, cosméticos y zapatos. En la actualidad tiene una pequeña tienda, con el apoyo incondicional de su hermana ha hecho prosperar su negocio y ha logrado comprar mercadería al por mayor, lo que le produjo una mejor ganancia. 
Ella cree fielmente en lo que hace, es por eso que desea apostar a más, por eso solicita un financiamiento que le permita comprar pacas completas de, ropa, zapatos, ropa para cama y carteras. También planea establecer una alianza con una marca de cosméticos de su ciudad para ser una distribuidora de sus productos. Janet tiene como principal meta convertirse en una mujer empresaria exitosa y pone todo su esfuerzo para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Janet is an enterprising woman who began working at a very young age selling merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics and shoes. She currently has a small store and with the unconditional support of her sister, she has made her business prosper and succeeded in buying merchandise wholesale, which produced better profits.

Because she believes faithfully in what she does, she wishes to take a chance for more, so she is requesting funding that will allow her to buy complete packs of clothing, shoes, bedclothes and purses. She also plans to establish an alliance with a cosmetics brand in her city to become a distributor of its products. Janet’s main goal is to become a successful businesswoman and she is applying all her effort to achieve it.

loans.use: buy complete packs of clothing, shoes, bedclothes and purses.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Hoima Uganda. She is a single and hardworking woman aged 50 years. She ventured into farming whereby she mainly grows cassava, maize and guts supplemented by incomes from owning a private school. 

She hopes to expand and develop her business the more despite the difficulty of seasonality changes. She is seeking for a credit facility to set up a new cassava plantation.

loans.use: to set up a new cassava plantation.

loans.name: Diana Catalina

texts.es:
Diana es una joven campesina de una zona rural del municipio de Medellín. Vive con su esposo y está en proceso de tener su primer bebe.

Ella desea ganarse la vida con la cría y venta de pollos de engorde y huevos desde su casa.

Ella se acerca a la Corporación Interactuar para solicitar un préstamo y comprar materiales para la construcción de un galpón, comprar gallinas ponedoras y alimento para su sostenimiento.

Apoya a Diana con un préstamo para que su hijo pueda tener un buen futuro a través de este negocio!
texts.en:
Diana is a young woman of the countryside in a rural zone in the municipality of Medellín. She lives with her husband and is in the process of having her first baby.

She wants to earn her living raising and selling chickens for meat and eggs from her home.

She approached Corporación Interactuar to ask for a loan to purchase materials to build a chicken coop, and to purchase laying hens and feed for their sustenance.

Support Diana with a loan so that her child can have a good future through this business!

loans.use: to purchase materials to make a chicken coop, and to purchase laying hens and feed to sustain them.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria came to the United States from the Dominican Republic as a teenager. She jumped right into life in the US and eventually graduated from a US high school and quickly found a job as a customs officer at the Newark airport. 

After a several-year-long career at the airport, Maria was unexpectedly let go due to budget cuts during the recent recession. Trying to seek work, she reached out to friends for ideas of what she should do for her next big step in her career. One close friend suggested she invest her time and her small savings in a transportation business. She saved up and purchased a straight truck in 2010, contracting with several companies and developing a reputation for her promptness and reliability across the region. 

Maria later expanded her business to carry a fleet of two trucks, but even with two, she is unable to meet the demand for her services. She is requesting this loan to purchase a third truck for her fleet so she can continue to grow her business as a trailblazing woman in the transportation industry.

loans.use: to purchase a truck for her transport business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks for resale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 52 years old and widow with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc..

Evelyn has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an irrigation system so that his corn crop develops well.

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es:
María, está creciendo con su negocio gracias a la ayuda de los créditos que le confían los inversionistas Kiva y Padecomsm, está experimentando un estilo de vida familiar más confortable, cuenta con clientes satisfecho y ha reducido sus deudas. Comenta que nuevamente se cambió de loca, ya que las demandas son mayores y logro ubicarse sobre la carretera principal, espera que ahí sus ventas sean mayores y tenga mejores ingresos.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en aceite, bebidas, verduras, carnes, condimentos, servilletas, platos, etc., prepara un menú de comida más variado y dará mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is growing with her business, thanks to the help of the loans that the Kiva investors and Padecomsm have trusted her with. She is experiencing a more comfortable lifestyle with her family and has satisfied customers and has reduced her debts. She says that she has again changed her location, since the demand is higher and she managed to situate herself on the principal highway. She hopes that there her sales will be greater and to have more income.

The loan that she asks for will be invested in oil, drinks, vegetables, meat, seasonings, napkins, plates, etc., to prepare a more varied menu of dishes and give better service to her customers.

loans.use: to invest in oil, drinks, vegetables, meat, seasonings, napkins, plates, etc., to prepare a more varied menu of dishes.

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es:
Evelio, de 24 años se gana la vida con el transporte de personas a través de las veredas del municipio de turbo. 

Es un hombre organizado y muy trabajador, intenta siempre salir adelante con gran esfuerzo y dedicación.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de un moto-taxi con el cual podrá mejorar su servicio, pues con este vehículo puede transportar más personas en un solo viaje; lo que representa un aumento en sus ingresos y disminución en sus costos.
texts.en:
Evelio, 24 years old, earns his living by transporting people through the streets of the municipality of Turbo.

He is an organized and very hard-working man, always intent on getting ahead with great effort and dedication.

He asks for a loan to purchase a motorcycle taxi with which he will be able to improve his service, since with this vehicle he will be able to transport more people in one trip, which will represent an increase in his income and a reduction in his costs.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Florensia

texts.en:
Florensia LIves in Oecusse - she is married and she has no children. She is applying for a loan of $ 1500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of clothes and she is also selling in the market. She is taking this loan because she wants to add to her working capital to buy more clothes, such as children clothes, short-sleeved shirts, pants, underwear and other things to sell. 

Florensia has been involving in business activities since 2012, which she started with her own working capital of $500.00. She is earning a good income from selling clothes because many people like to buy, so she is still happy to do her business. And with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she hopes to run her business in a bigger store.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes,short-sleeved shirts, pants, underwear and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his house in order to create more space for his growing children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheet metal, lumber, and nails to change the roof of his home and improve security for his family.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer works hard to support her family. Jennifer is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Jennifer requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more abaca fiber for her business.

Jennifer has been in this business for 10 years now.

Jennifer would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more abaca fiber for her business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 35 years old, married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell .

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from selling vinegar.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 54 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lolita has a selling frozen foods and soft-drinks business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods and cases of soft-drinks to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods and cases of soft-drinks to sell

loans.name: Nicole

texts.en:
Nicole and her partner Heather (pictured together above), own and manage the Hudson Street Organic Baby & Kids Boutique in Montclair, NJ. They are passionate about giving children the best odds for a happy and healthy life, and believe that one of the ways to help make that happen is to make sure children are not exposed to dangerous toxins in their daily lives by selecting safe materials and ingredients for what they wear and eat. 

Nicole and Heather aspire to help Montclair families make healthy choices by providing safe, stylish, and affordable clothing and accessories for babies and children, and they promise that every item they sell is 100% organic and completely safe for kids. This loan will help them purchase more inventory and develop a cushion so they can continue to grow their business and offer a healthy alternative in children's clothing to their community.

loans.use: to have working capital to purchase more inventory for her organic baby and children's clothing shop

loans.name: Manolvi

texts.en:
Manolvi is a first generation American, having come here with his family when he was 11 years old. After graduating from Perth Amboy High School in Perth Amboy, NJ, he immediately went off on his own and began working for his current employer, Pro Tapes, in 2005. 

In 2010, he added a second full-time job as a truck driver. He recently came upon an opportunity to go off on his own, and with encouragement and support from his girlfriend Jessica (pictured with him above), he started his own trucking company in February of this year.

Manolvi, who still holds two full-time jobs while starting his own business, works very hard, and incidentally so does his truck. He is requesting this loan to help him make much needed repairs so he can continue to grow his trucking company.

loans.use: to make repairs on his truck.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: Doña Luz de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella posee una molino nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 18 años, posee muchos clientes especialmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas ya que ahí llegan a moler el maíz,  con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa, ella solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para comprar lo necesario para el molino como fajas, discos, cuchillas, etc. y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Luz is 51 years old, and she lives in her own home with her son. She has had a corn flour mill located at her place of residence for 18 years. She has many customers, especially the women who make tortillas, since they come to Luz to grind corn. With what she earns from her sales, she has managed to take care of some of the expenses of her household.

Luz is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy items necessary for grinding such as belts, discs, blades, etc. As a result, Luz will earn more money and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy belts, discs, blades, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Lydia has been in this business for 24 years. Lydia earns more income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca lives in Oecusse and she is a business women. She has been doing business since 2007 with her own working capital of $200.00. 

She is requesting a loan of $800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, cooking oils, ketchup, sauces, crackers, condiments and other things to sell. She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve her management of her business. With the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she hopes she can increase her incomes.

loans.use: To buy cooking oils, ketchup, sauces, crackers, condiments and other things to sell.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La señora Felicidad vive en el trópico es concubina tiene 2 hijos, se fue al trópico en busca de una mejor oportunidad de  vida para su familia, en su anterior comunidad la producción era baja debido a los cambios climatológicos, ahora tiene un lote  agrícola y un lote urbano que se compró con mucho sacrificio, ambos trabajan en el chaco, son personas responsables y trabajadores. Su actividad económica es la producción de yuca, tiene en producción dos hectáreas y ½ en proceso de crecimiento, con el crédito solicitado ampliará su producción para generar más ingresos y así pagar los gastos de su familia, los productos se comercializan en el mismo terreno agrícola a comerciantes de yuca de la comunidad. Con las ganancias que generara este año refaccionara su vivienda, actualmente su casa es de madera y asi podra vivir mas comodamente.
texts.en:
Señora Felicidad lives in the tropics. She has a partner and 2 children. She went to the tropics in search for a better life for her family. In her previous community, the production was low due to climatic changes. Now, she has a plot of land for agriculture and an urban plot of land that she bought after much sacrifice. Both her and her partner work on the farm, and they are responsible and hardworking people. She grows yuca, and has two and a half productive hectares and growing.

With the requested loan, Felicidad will increase her production to earn more income, and pay for the expenses of her family. She sells her products at her farm to yuca merchants in the community. With the profit that she will make this year, she will refurbish her home. Currently, her home is made of wood, and after refurbishing she will be able to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to increase her yuca production to earn more income, and pay for the expenses of her family.

loans.name: Myagmar

texts.en:
Mr. Myagmar is 48 years old and lives with his wife in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as driver at a private company for more than twenty years. His wife has been running grocery store since 2009. Their children are all grown up and live on their own. 

The house they live in has been deteriorating so he demolished it and is currently living in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling). He is requesting a loan of 5650000 MNT to buy building materials such as planks, cement, bricks and shingles to rebuild house on his land before fall. 

By doing so, he and his wife will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, releasing less pollutant into air.

loans.use: to build a new house to replace his former one which was demolished

loans.name: María Ester

texts.es: María Ester, tiene la edad  de 67 años, está soltera,  vive sola, la cual trabaja para su superación. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de café y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo de su cosecha, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en su bienestar y cumplir con algunas metas  y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
María Ester is 67 years old, single, lives alone, and is working to improve herself. With the loan she intends to buy fertilizers and other products to use in the cultivation of coffee so that she makes good progress, as well as paying for labor to help her apply the products and help around the plantation once she gets a good harvest, so that she can ensure she does a good job.
She wants to make the most of the good conditions of the climate and the soil for her crops in the area, put into practice the years of experience she has in the handling of coffee, and also be able to buy the best quality products for her plantation to develop well and healthily to get a good harvest and an important yield in the short term. She wants to use the income from the harvest which she hopes to get for her wellbeing, to accomplish a few objectives, and to continue to invest in her crops.
This is the first loan which she has received from FUDECOSUR. She had not had other state bank loans before, but FUDECOSUR have provided her with a loan with good terms and a low interest rate.

loans.use: to grow coffee

loans.name: Anita De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Anita de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años e inicio con capital propio, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Anita is 54 years old, and she lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. She has had a bakery in her home for 5 years, and she started her business with her own capital. She has many customers due to the quality of her products. With the profit that she makes, she has been able to get ahead and take care of household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, different flavors of gelatin, molds, etc. Through this, she will be able to continue working, and earn more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, different flavors of gelatin, molds, etc.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Isata. She is married and has three children, aged 10, 6 and 4. She has one additional dependent who stays with her for schooling.

In 2007, Isata established her plastic pan and dishes business. She began her business just to enhance her independence. Her business is located at the city center, and her main customers are both men and women. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about 700,000 SLL every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Isata has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy dozens of plastic dishes and pans for resale. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock level. In the future, Isata plans to rent a larger shop and to educate her children. 

She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastic dishes

loans.name: Juana Melida

texts.es:
Juana, de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, no pudo seguir estudiando porque sus padres no contaban con los recursos económicos suficientes, está casada, su esposo trabaja como jornalero sembrando granos básicos como maíz, frijol y maicillo y es madre de 4 hijos, pero solo 3 viven aún en casa.

Juana, se dedica junto a sus hijos a sembrar granos básicos como maíz, frijol, maicillo y caña de azúcar  desde hace 25 años, ya que no hay otra fuente de ingresos que le permita tener ingresos para ella y su familia, ella desde pequeña iba con sus padres al lugar donde ellos trabajaban y ahí aprendío, antes hacia pan y tamales para salir a vender, dado a que no hay quien le ayude ya no trabaja en ello y el lugar donde ellos trabajan está a 15 minutos de su casa y generalmente trabajan de 6:00 a.m. a 12:00 m.d.

Juana, necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar insumos agricolas como maíz, fertilizantes e insecticidas para mejorar sus cosechas, tambien pagara parte de la mano de obra. 

Los sueños de Juana, es mejorar el área de cocina de su casa, ya que está deteriorado el techo y se moja cuando llueve; también quiere que sus hijos se preparen academicamente, para que puedan ejercer una profesión.
texts.en:
Juana is 49 years old, and she studied up until the third grade. She couldn't continue studying because her parents didn't have enough money. She is married, and her husband works as a day laborer farming staple grains such as corn, beans, and sorghum. She is the mother of 4 children, but only 3 of them still live with her.

Juana has made a living with her children farming staple grains such as corn, beans, sorghum, and sugarcane for 25 years. There isn't any other source of income that would enable Juana to earn money for her and her family. When she was young, Juana used to go with her parents to the place where they worked, and through this she learned the occupation. She used to make and sell bread and tamales, but since there is no one to help her now, she doesn't work in this occupation any longer. The place where Juana and her children work is 15 minutes from their home, and they generally work from 6:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.

Juana needs the money from this loan to buy agricultural supplies such as corn, fertilizer, and insecticides to improve her harvest, and also to pay for part of the cost of labor.

Juana dreams of improving the kitchen in her home, since her roof is deteriorating and it leaks when it rains. She would also like for her children to be prepared academically so that they can work in a profession.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as corn, fertilizer and insecticides in order to improve her harvest, and also to pay for part of the cost of labor.

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es: Ovidio, tiene la edad  de 70 años, está casado, vive con su hija y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  materiales para poder hacer la construcción de un local donde pueda tener y desarrollar algunos cerdos para el engorde.  La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene y las buenas condiciones para ubicar un chiquero  para los cerdos. Además de obtener unos cerdos de buena calidad que a corto plazo puedan estar gordos y de buena calidad. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar la actividad, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en el proyecto y a la vez darle más ingresos económicos a su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ovidio is 70 years old and married. He lives with his daughter and his wife who are his main priority. With his loan he wants to buy materials to construct a space where he can have and raise pigs. His idea is to take advantage of an area he has with good conditions to locate a pen for the pigs. He will also obtain some high quality pigs that can be fattened in a short amount of time and be of good quality. With this purchase he can develop this activity and at the same time have savings that will allow him to have more animals and invest more in the project which will produce more economic revenues for his family. This is the first loan he had had from FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans from the State banks and FUDECOSUR has provided this loan with better conditions and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to construct a pigpen and buy some pigs to raise.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is a stay-at-home mother of four, and she was looking for a way to generate some additional income for her family when she heard about Mary Kay.

After attending a makeup party, she decided that it would be a great way to work from home and start making her own income by selling beauty products. She loves the culture of Mary Kay and was really excited about the prospect of starting her own business.

“I love how I can sell Mary Kay on my own time, and how they give women a chance at entrepreneurship,” stated Melissa.

Melissa will be receiving training from her Mary Kay director, and any support necessary to build her clientele list, both in person and online.

Melissa will use her Kiva loan to buy inventory and new products for her business. She says the biggest challenge has been getting clients, but she is hard at work networking and getting her name out in the community.

loans.use: to buy inventory and new products for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a sachet and bottled water business in her house

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Originally from Colombia, Elizabeth moved to the US and began working as a salesperson selling Spanish products, such as Goya, not easily acquired in the US. While searching for bodega clients in this role, she discovered there was a big and untapped market for Spanish products and decided to open her own store. In 2010 she opened La Estrella Supermarket, a grocery store and deli, in Union City, NJ and quickly built a strong reputation in the community due to her positive attitude, friendly demeanor, and great professionalism.

Her supermarket offers grocery staples as well as fresh deli meats and prepared Colombian food including rice, beans, sandwiches, and empanadas. The store is one of the largest food markets in the area that carries specialty items such as Goya products. She lives in the apartment above the store, and every morning she wakes up early so she can open at 7:00 am to serve breakfast and provide lunch to customers who stop in to take some to work with them. A single mother of two, she enlists her kids in helping her reliably keep the store open seven days a week from 7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. Her son works full-time for her, and her daughter helps out a few hours a week.

This loan will help Elizabeth to purchase more inventory for her grocery store and deli so she can continue to provide delicious Colombian foods and grocery staples to the community of Union City, New Jersey.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her deli.

loans.name: Maria Aminta

texts.es: Maria de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace 13 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio está ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, adicional también posee un molino, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y así poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 35 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. For thirteen years she has been making and selling pupusas. Her business is located close to her house in a busy area. She also has a mill. She manages to pay some of the household expenses with what she makes from her sales. She is requesting a loan to buy pork cracklings, cheese, beans. corn and other ingredients. In this way she can continue with her work which generates good income.

loans.use: to buy pork cracklings, cheese, beans. corn and other ingredients.

loans.name: Rae

texts.en:
Rae has a passion for helping people pursue their dreams. After she relocated to San Diego from Detroit in 2005 with her son and husband, she began working as a mortgage consultant. At the same time, she was also pursuing a degree in counseling and psychology. By the end of her degree program, she decided that she did not want to be a therapist directly, so instead she decided to pursue coaching.

She began her business, All The Way Success, in May 2009. All The Way Success is a training and development company providing workshops, seminars, and coaching for businesses from small sole-proprietorship up to large corporations.

Her business focuses on training surrounding leadership development, team building, systems and processes, and marketing. Up to this point, the business has been serving mostly small sole-proprietor businesses; however, these businesses run into cash flow issues and therefore are unable to pay for the services in a timely manner. Therefore, Rae has begun to work with larger, more established corporations to ensure income stability throughout the year.

To market her business, Rae participates in a number of speaking engagements, especially at large conferences. She speaks at approximately two to three events or conferences per month. She encourages potential clients to have a ‘discovery session’ with her, so they can see how her services will benefit them. She also offers webinars, and has been working on developing a strong Facebook and LinkedIn presence.

Rae will use her Kiva loan to update her website, hire a part-time employee, and purchase inventory to re-sell at conferences, namely a book she has written about entrepreneurship.

With your help, Rae can expand her business and assist more business owners around California.

Find out more about Rae: http://allthewaysuccess.com/

loans.use: to update her website, hire a part-time employee, and purchase inventory.

loans.name: Reyna Guadalupe

texts.es: Reyna tiene 25 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas de 7 y 6 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos naturales por la mañana y por la tarde vende productos por catálogo y es de esa manera que se gana la vida para sacar adelante a sus hijas como madre soltera. Reyna obtuvo un crédito anteriormente el cual utilizo para hacer un afinado de paredes y ahora ella desea cambiar el techo de la vivienda, por lo que ella solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para compra de: laminas, madera y clavos para poder hacer las reparaciones lo antes posible por la época de invierno.
texts.en: Reyna is 25 years old and lives in her own house with her two children aged 7 and 6 years old. She works selling natural drinks in the mornings and in the afternoon sells products from catalogs. In this way she makes a living to raise her children as a single mother. Reyna got a previous loan to finish the walls of her house and now she wants to replace the roof. So she is requesting a new loan from FUSAI to buy laminated sheeting, wood and nails so she can make these repairs as quickly as possible before it is winter.

loans.use: to buy laminated sheeting, wood and nails to replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 41 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school. Ruth works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of products to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Ruth has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Ruth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of products to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 42 years old and has four children. She is married, and three of her children are in school.

Liezel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Liezel would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, coloring, and yeast, etc. to make her business grow.

loans.name: Amorlina

texts.en:
Amorlina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amorlina is 46 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Amorlina has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Amorlina has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana has been involved in business activities since 2013, when she started with her own working capital of $250. She has a kiosk in her house, and now she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

She is taking this loan because wants used to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including noodles, biscuits, soap, sugar, salt, detergent, hard drinks, and other things to sell. She is pleased with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because with this loan, she can improve her management of her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, biscuits, soap, sugar, salt, detergent, hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Amable

texts.es: Amable, tiene la edad  de 38 años, está casada, vive con su esposo y sus hijos,  los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol que se adapte bién a las condiciones de la zona y de buena calidad y que tenga una buena germinación y de fertilizantes que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones del suelo y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno y de labores que le ayuden a que el agua de lluvia no cause daños por la erosión, y también para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Amable is 38 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children who are her main priority. With her loan she wants to buy bean seed that adapts well to the conditions of her area, are of good quality and germinate well. She will also buy fertilizer to help improve the soil conditions and other products to apply when seeding. She will pay for labor to prepare the earth and work to help prevent erosion from the rain waters, apply the products and assist the crops so they develop well. In this way she will be assured of having done good work
.
What she wants to do is take advantage of the good soil and climatic conditions that this zone has for growing and put into practice her years of experience growing basic grains. Besides being able to buy better quality products so that her crops grow well, are healthy and produce a good yield and in a short period of time she will have a large output. With the income from the harvest she hopes to have, she will use it for the well-being and education of her family and fulfill some family goals and continue to invest more in her crops.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had a loan from the State banks before and FUDECOSUR is providing the loan with better condition and much lower rates of interest.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.en:
Herminigilda is 48 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of goods to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soap, noodles, etc.

Herminigilda has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and a vulcanizing shop.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of goods to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soap, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Santa Catarina Ii Group

texts.es:
Juana  es una mujer de 35 años de edad, es soltero vive junto a sus dos hijos uno de ellos estudia en la escuela de su comunidad y una de ellos ya no estudia, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Juana ( es la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía de blusa negra con rosas) aparte de cooperar con la artesanía de su comunidad  también le genera sus ingresos pues ella tiene diez años de realizar esta labor, gracias a los años que tiene de experiencia elabora los mejores trajes típicos de su comunidad.
Juana con el afán de seguir prosperando y ofrecerle a sus clientes trajes de  buena calidad y buenos precios ha tomado la iniciativa de solicitar un  préstamo para comprar hilos de tipo seda, alemán y lustrina para seguir elaborando hermosos trajes típicos.
Juana  sueña con poder contar con un local donde pueda exhibir mejor sus productos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is a 35-year-old woman, is single and lives together with her two children. One of them studies in the school in their community and one no longer studies. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

Juana, who is the first one from the right side in the photograph and wears a black blouse with roses, collaborates in the production of her community's handicrafts, which she has been doing for the past ten years. Thanks to her years of experience, she produces the best traditional clothing in her community.

Juana is motivated to continue prospering and offering her customers good quality clothing and good prices, so she has taken the initiative to request a loan to buy silk, rayon and lustrina [shiny silk or cotton] thread to continue producing beautiful traditional clothing. Juana dreams of being able to have a shop where she can exhibit her products in a better way, and to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy silk, rayon and lustrina thread

loans.name: Yeni Andrea

texts.es: Yeni de 19 años de edad una joven muy emprendedora y con ganas de sacar adelante a su madre y a su hermanito, a falta de un padre que les ayude ella se vio obligada a anular sus planes de poder tener una educación superior. ahora en día ella se dedica a trabajar para ayudar a su madre y su hermano menor ella vende ropa y productos de belleza y lociones por catalogo, dicha actividad la realiza en el municipio donde vive ella visita a sus clientes para vender la ropa que vende y junto con esto los catálogos de los productos de belleza sus clientes la prefieren porque es muy amable. Ella esta solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento y ladrillo de piso para instalar ladrillo de piso y mejorar las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Yeni, who is 19 years old, is a very entrepreneurial young woman who is eager to get her mother and little brother ahead. Lacking a father to help her, she was forced to cancel her plans to attend higher education. Nowadays she works helping her mother and younger brother. She sells clothes, beauty products and lotions by catalogue. She does this in the municipality where she lives, visiting her customers to sell clothes and to show them the beauty product catalogues. Her customers prefer her because she is very kind.

She is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: sand, cement and floor bricks to install brick floors and improve the walls of her house.

loans.use: to invest in: sand, cement and floor bricks to install brick floors and improve the walls of her house

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Mrs. Narangerel, 36 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She has been selling children's clothes to local people since 2011. Before this business, she had sold fruits and foods. Her husband has worked as a fire fighter for twenty years. Their children both go to school.

The house her family lives in has been deteriorating over the years and it needs urgent repair. So she is requesting a loan of 5000000 MNT to buy planks, cements and fiberglass for house renovation. After renovation, her family will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, releasing less pollutant into air. 

The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to renovate her house which is in bad repair and then use less coal for heating

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 54 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Eva works very hard to provide for them.

Eva runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as shampoo, fabric conditioners, bread, coffee, etc. to sell.

Eva has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, fabric conditioners, bread, coffee, etc.

Eva would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as shampoo, fabric conditioners, bread, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Lucilla

texts.en:
Lucila is 58 years old and a widow with seven children.

Lucila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries.

Lucila has been in this business for two years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Lucila aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries.

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en:
Arlinda is 51 years old and is married with five children. Two children are still in school and Arlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Arlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like bread, cooking oil, dried fish, candies, noodles, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Arlinda has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Arlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like bread, cooking oil, dried fish, candies, noodles, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a 56-year-old married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Fe has a business buying and selling native products in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Fe has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Fe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more native products to sell

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 48 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 23500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Angelina has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 49 years old and has five children. Marites is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Marites is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marites has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $1000.00 is offered to Maria to improve her business. She has a small kiosk and she is requesting this loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to add to her working capital to buy more additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as noodles, biscuits, soaps, sugar, salts, coffee, shampoo, candles, candies and other things to sell. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2013, with her own working capital of $400.00. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can increase her income.  Running a business has made Maria independent because she can be responsible for her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, biscuits, soaps, sugar, salt, coffee, shampoo, candles, candies and other things to sell.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 32 years old, married with four children.

Marcela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Marcela has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from selling firewood and charcoal.

Marcela aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Khanifa

texts.en:
"There is nothing that's too late to start, and it's never too late to learn". According to these words this heroine, named Khanifa, leads her life. She is 56 years old and the mother of two children. Her husband went to the Russian Federation as a migrant worker long ago, and he still lives there. 

Khanifa decided to start her own livestock breeding business. 60% of Tajikistan's population work with agriculture, and Khanifa will not lag behind them anymore. She decided to purchase calves, fatten them for a few months and then sell them. She applied for financial support in order to purchase her first calves and start her business. Please help her.

loans.use: to start a livestock breeding business

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
Jasmine is a 36-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jasmine has a ice cream vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business.

Jasmine has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 40 years old with four children. With all four children in school, Leonila works very hard to provide for them.

Leonila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snacks, liquor, toiletries and other groceries.

Leonila has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as beverages, soap, coffee, shampoo, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snacks, liquor, toiletries and other groceries

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 44 years old and is married with five children. With three children currently in school, Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like shampoo, canned goods, cereals milk, juice, soft-drinks, beers, etc. to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like shampoo, canned goods, cereal, milk, juice, soft-drinks, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 46 years old and is married with four children.  Felomina works hard to provide for her family. 

She sells charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal.

Felomina has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 3 years and also earns income from pig raising, and selling nipa (palm leaf) roofing.

Felomina aspires to save enough to have a general store.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has business selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Lucena has been in this business for 5 years and also earns income from a general store.

Lucena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Helen is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel is a 39-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marivel has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Marivel has requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Marivel has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Marivel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Ma. Erma

texts.en:
Ma. Erma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She has a candy-making business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her candy business.

Ma. Erma dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her candy making business.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 59 years old, with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Luzviminda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, toiletries, and other groceries.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as milk, biscuits, soap, shampoo, noodles, coffee, etc.. 

In the future, Luzviminda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, toiletries, and other groceries

loans.name: Seanglorn's Group

texts.en:
Seanglorn lives in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province,and is 24-year-old. 

Nowadays, she grows sesame as the main source for her family’s income but for six years, she has also sold grocery items to earn extra income. She makes about 63,000KHR per day and saves around 37,000KHR each day from her expenses. Low sesame yields and drought are the main challenge for her business. 

She is a group leader of three female members who have never been with KIVA’s partner, VisionFund. Seanglorn will use her portion to buy seeds for her sesame growing. She hopes to have enough sales so as to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow sesame

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is selling gasoline because she is earning a good income from this business. She lives near the main road, and every day many people come to buy her gasoline, so she is still happy to do her business.

Sabina has been involved in business activities since a few years ago. She started with her own working capital of $150. When Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan to her, she said that with this loan she will improve her management of her business so she can run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase soap, detergent,  sweet bread, candy, etc for stocking her store.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina, 35, lives in a remote area of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. He is a married man who has three dependent children. 

To make a living, Lina manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers. He is able to make a net profit of USD 5.00 per day, on average. So far, he has been involved in this type of business for more than ten years. 

Lina wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system.  Because there is inadequate money, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, he hopes to have clean energy to power his household lights, TV and radio. He is very happy and thankful because of this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. 

He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy home system

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 39 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school.

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Elvira has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Elvira aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 34 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Maricel works very hard to provide for them.

Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Maricel has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, juice, coffee, diapers, eggs, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. 

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa works hard to support her family. Teresa is married and has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines.

Teresa requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of Avon products to sell.

Teresa has been in this business for 4 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

In the future, Teresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of Avon products to sell

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en:
Leng is 34 years old and a mother of two dependent children, who are both in school.  She lives in Svay Reang province. 

Leng raises pigs for sale and grows rice as the main sources of her family’s income. She has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and completely paid back the loan. The last loan helped her to have better living conditions. 

Due to the lack of funds to expand her current businesses, she is now leading a group of two to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy more piglets to raise and to buy farming supplies to support her farming business. 

She hopes that this loan will help her earn more income and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise for sale and buy farming supplies

location.town: Svay Reang Province, Svay Chrom District

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa live in Oecusse, and is married.

She is a business women selling gasoline, which she started to sell a few years ago with her own working capital of $150.00. She hopes to grow her business, but her savings are not enough, so she is requesting this loan of $800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin.to buy more gasoline. She lives near the main road so many people come to buy her gasoline. 

She is very happy with her business.

loans.use: To buy more gasoline.

loans.name: Kay

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Kay is 43-year-old and a father of four children, only one of them is in school. For his living, he has been growing cassava and rice for twenty-three years. His daily family income earns him about 58,000KHR per day, but he is able to save around 32,000KHR each day after offsetting his family expenses. Low cassava yields are the main challenge for him. 

This is his first loan cycle; Kay has never been with VisionFund before. He will use his entire loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for worker fees for his farmland. He highly hopes that this loan will help him to timely get a good price from his cassava to buy more plots of farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for worker fees for his farmland

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Agée de 39 ans, Amivi est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida. Dans son quartier, Amivi vend des céréales à ses clients et trouve son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Amivi s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché. Amivi demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs afin de réaliser encore plus de revenus pour soutenir  les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Amivi, aged 39, is a married woman living in Baguida. In her district, she sells grains to her customers and makes an income, thanks to this business. To respond effectively to the need, she gets her supplies five times a month at the market. Amivi is asking for this loan to order sacks of corn to realize still more revenues for meeting day-to-day family needs.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of corn

loans.name: Djamba

texts.fr: Djamba est âgée de 49 ans et vit à Baguida. Mariée, elle a deux enfants à sa charge et travaille dynamiquement pour aider son mari pour leur épanouissement. Djamba vend des céréales dans son quartier en les livrant aux clients à son domicile. Djamba s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des bols de farine de blé et du maïs, Djamba demande ce prêt pour réaliser son objectif et gagner un profit pour contribuer à l’avancement de la famille.
texts.en: Djamba, aged 49, lives in Baguida. A married woman, she has two children to support and works energetically to help out her husband for them to thrive. She sells grains out of her home in her district by making deliveries to customers. She gets her supplies five times a month at the market. To purchase tubs of wheat flour and of corn, Djamba is asking for this loan to realize her goals and to earn a profit, which helps the family to advance.

loans.use: to purchase 30 tubs of flour and a sack of corn

loans.name: Kokoé

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Kokoè est une femme mariée qui vit avec trois enfants à Baguida. Pour favoriser leur épanouissement, Kokoè vend des habits faits de pagne en parcourant tout son quartier afin de trouver le revenu nécessaire. Kokoè réalise son gain grâce à cette activité et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des pièces de pagne, Kokoè demande ce fonds pour favoriser sa commande et avoir une marge bénéficiaire qui l’aidera à mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Kokoè, aged 33, is a married woman living with three children in Baguida. For them to thrive, she sells clothing made from 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) by going throughout her district to make the income necessary. Thanks to this business, she makes a profit. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market. To purchase lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth, Kokoè is asking for these funds to put in an order [for merchandise] and have a profit margin that will help her meet family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 5 lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and married with 4 children.  With  children in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like candies, chips, can goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Gina has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as . 

In the future Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like candies, chips, can goods, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 41 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.
